title: Rewards Program (Trend Coins)
problem: Low retention and weak repeat purchase behavior among Gen-Z users, with discount dependence and limited engagement between orders.
goals: Boost prepaid adoption to reduce returns
Lift conversion and average order value by creating engaging, playful incentives
my_role: Led research, design, benchmarking, and product definition for the Trend Coins loyalty ecosystem; partnered with design and engineering to scope and iterate product flows.
key_decisions: Unified a single currency (Trend Coins) to simplify reward earning and redemption across touchpoints
Surface reward opportunities at checkout and other decision points to make rewards tangible
Design brand-aligned, playful identity for trend coins to resonate with Gen-Z users
execution: Conducted research to benchmark competitor loyalty programs and understand Gen-Z motivators
Iterated multiple design concepts (gamified flows, progress nudges, visibility across UI)
Implemented coin visibility in navigation, checkout, profile, and success screens
metrics: Improved retention by creating gamified reward touchpoints
Positive shifts in prepaid adoption via visible reward incentives
Increased conversion and AOV by making rewards part of checkout decisions
impact: Trend Coins transformed discount-driven transactions into a loyalty engine that improved retention, engagement, and prepaid adoption.
learnings: Simplicity and visibility matter more than overly complex tier systems
Rewards must be playful and integrated directly into key decision flows
Brand-aligned identity enhances emotional connection and long-term engagement

title: Referral Program for New User Acquisition
problem: High customer acquisition costs and limited organic growth channels, with a need to acquire high-intent users efficiently.
goals: Leverage existing users as a growth channel
my_role: Owned the end-to-end referral program including incentive design, eligibility rules, flow definition, and collaboration with design and engineering teams.
key_decisions: Reward both referrer and referee to maximize participation
Offer cash incentive to referrer and discount to referee to balance motivation and cost
Trigger rewards only after successful first order to ensure user quality
execution: Designed referral flows across app entry points and post-purchase moments
Defined reward logic, eligibility rules, and success conditions
Worked with engineering to implement referral tracking and reward fulfillment
Monitored performance and iterated on incentives to balance cost and quality
metrics: Incremental new users acquired through referrals
Improved acquisition efficiency compared to paid channels
Healthy first-order conversion from referred users
impact: The referral program became a scalable acquisition lever, driving incremental new users while helping reduce overall acquisition costs.
learnings: Rewarding both sides significantly improves participation rates
Tying rewards to first successful orders improves user quality
Simple, transparent incentives outperform complex referral mechanics

title: POS and Inventory Management System
problem: Dependence on third-party systems created operational bottlenecks, high costs, and limited visibility into inventory across offline stores and the organization.
goals: Eliminate third-party billing and inventory dependencies
Improve billing speed and accuracy at stores
Enable real-time inventory visibility across the organization
my_role: Owned the project end-to-end, from conceptualization and user research to PRD creation, prioritization, execution, and training store teams on the new system.
key_decisions: Build an in-house POS and inventory system to remove third-party constraints
Design workflows optimized for store staff with minimal operational friction
Prioritize billing accuracy and inventory consistency over feature breadth in v1
execution: Conducted user research with store teams to identify pain points and workflow gaps
Defined end-to-end requirements for billing, inventory updates, returns, and exchanges
Worked closely with engineering to build an enterprise-grade POS system
Led store onboarding and training to ensure smooth adoption
impact: Delivered a highly reliable POS and inventory system that enabled smooth offline operations, reduced errors, eliminated third-party costs, and significantly improved inventory visibility across the organization.
learnings: Operational products require deep empathy for frontline users
Simplicity and reliability matter more than feature richness in high-stakes systems
Strong change management is critical when replacing core operational tools

title: Post-Purchase Experience & Customer Support Bot
problem: Post-purchase journeys (delivery, returns) had friction and limited visibility, leading to lower NPS and high support load on customer service agents.
goals: Enhance overall customer experience after purchase
Reduce support ticket volume through better self-serve and bot interactions
my_role: Led improvements across post-purchase UX flows and customer support automation, working across product, design, engineering, and support operations.
key_decisions: Identify and remove bottlenecks in delivery and returns user journeys
Integrate an external customer support platform to improve automation
Prioritize bot workflows that resolve common queries without human intervention
execution: Mapped end-to-end post-purchase user journeys to identify friction points
Improved UX and UI across delivery tracking and returns flows
Designed workflows and automation rules to improve bot interactions
metrics: NPS for post-delivery and returns surveys
Number of tickets handled by agents
impact: Improved overall CSAT and post-purchase NPS while reducing the number of tickets handled by support agents through better UX and automation.
learnings: Small friction points in post-purchase flows significantly impact overall perception of the brand
Well-designed bot automation can improve both customer experience and operational efficiency
CX improvements require tight alignment between product and support teams
